title: Siren songs at 4,000 feet: why an exclusive trip to the depths of the great American canyons is an epic adventure
text:
America's national parks offer sensational views - none more so than its renowned canyons. And now you can tour these epic landscapes

There's a pull to a void. I sense it as I stand on a sandstone prow, over a clean drop, gazing at the kaleidoscope of colours on distant cliffs, 1,000 cubic miles of abyss in front of me. From the hot air below, I hear a siren's song as old and inhuman as the stone in the shadowy depths, and lurch backwards.

A little shaken, I return to the Grand Canyon Lodge, an early-20th-century inn of heavy wood and wholesome, outdoorsy Americana. Guests clad in Mountain Hardwear and Patagonia offer treats to roaming chipmunks. We're on the North Rim of the Grand Canyon....
